title: Olof Hvidén-Watson
text: Olof Hvidén-Watson (born 10 August 1982) is a <a href="Sweden">Swedish</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a>. He became slightly famous in Norway in 2007 when he played for the Norwegian Premiership club Odd Grenland, most of the season. Towards the end of the 2007 season he was loaned out to first division side Bodø/Glimt. Hvidén-Watson ended up playing for Bodø/Glimt against Odd Grenland in the final play off match for The Premier Division. Bodø/Glimt won, and he helped relegate the club that owned him.
